response.thought: Bananas don't grow on trees; they grow on giant plants that just look like trees.
The word 'monsoon' comes from the Arabic word for 'month', as they historically lasted exactly one month.
If you fold a piece of paper 103 times, it would reach the size of the observable universe.
Octopuses have three hearts: two pump blood to the gills, and one pumps it to the rest of the body. The third heart stops when they swim, which is why they prefer crawling.
The Eiffel Tower grows about 6 inches taller during summer due to thermal expansion.
A single cloud can weigh as much as 1 million elephants.
The 'S' in Superman stands for both 'Superman' and 'Samuel', his biological father's first name in the original comics.
Penguins propose to their mates by offering a pebble.
The inventor of the Frisbee was buried in one.
There's a species of jellyfish that becomes immortal when it reaches its adult stage.
The first item ever barcoded was a pack of Wrigley's gum in 1974.
Human bones are stronger than concrete.
The Great Wall of China is not visible from space with the naked eye, contrary to popular belief.
Bananas are berries, but strawberries aren't.
The shortest war in history was between Zanzibar and Britain in 1896, lasting 38-45 minutes.
Octopuses have blue blood due to copper-based hemocyanin instead of hemoglobin.
The inventor of the Pac-Man ghost names thought 'Inky', 'Blinky', etc., were too cute, so he named them after his co-worker's personalities.
A group of flamingos is called a 'flamboyance'.
The dot over the letter 'i' is called a tittle.
The reason pencils have erasers is because someone thought it’d be convenient, despite the smudging risk.
